data.text:
Barzini, Luigi

New York: Library Press, 1973. Hardcover. Blue cloth boards with gilt lettering, White dustjacket with Photograph on both sides. 308 pages illustrations, map (on end papers). VG/G Some tears in and discoloration on dustjacket, pages clean and white. Previous owners name written on ffep. Item #180571

ISBN: 9780912050263

"Unforgettable account of the triumphant race of 1907. This historic and enthralling book involves two Barzinis- Luigi Sr., the famed editor of the Corriere della Sera, who rode across China, Siberia, and Russia in the horseless carriage of Prince Borghese to win what was called "the maddest motor race of all time"-and Luigi Jr., his brilliant son author of The Italians and From Caesar to the Mafia, who discovered new material and photographs and now inroduces this classic text of an almost unbelievable adventure."-Dustjacket.

OCLC: 924609
